value.name: About ENIGMA - Museum of Communication
value.snippet: At ENIGMA, we store Denmark's national collections within post and telecommunications and we hold Denmark's largest stamp collection as well as the country's most important specialist library within its field. In February 2023, ENIGMA will open new exhibition areas and a large children's area, in which we look forward to welcoming everyone. Vision

value.name: Om Enigma Museum for post, tele og kommunikation
value.snippet: Velkommen til ENIGMA – Museum for post, tele og kommunikation. Vi er vokset ud af det gamle Post & Telemuseum, der lå i Købmagergade, og bor nu i det smukke gamle posthus på Øster Allé ved Trianglen på Østerbro. ENIGMA er Danmarks kommunikationsmuseum. På ENIGMA opbevarer vi Danmarks nationale samlinger inden for post og tele og råder over Danmarks ...

value.name: ENIGMA – Museum for post, tele og kommunikation
value.snippet: ENIGMA – Museum for post, tele og kommunikation er under ombygning, men åbner snart. Vi glæder os meget til at byde velkommen til et helt nyt museum. På åbningsdagen 25. februar har vi åbent fra 14:00 - 17:00. ‍ENIGMA er et hus fyldt med aktiviteter og oplevelser. Et sted, hvor ordet sættes frit, og viden er i spil.

value.name: Museumsportal Berlin - Museum – Communication Museum
value.snippet: The Communication Museum (Museum für Kommunikation Berlin) brings the past and the future together under one roof. Its permanent exhibition makes it possible for visitors to comprehend and experience the origin, development and future opportunities of our information society.

value.name: Homepage – Museum für Kommunikation Berlin
value.snippet: Welcome to the Museum of Communication Berlin Past, present and future of communication About Us. Experience: COMMUNICATION. Broaden your horizons, discover amazing facts and have fun exploring interactive exhibits! Visit one of Berlin’s most attractive museums and become friends with our friendly robots ROBerta und ROBert.

value.name: The Communications Museum Trust - Home
value.snippet: The Communications Museum Trust - all about the past present and future of communications technology The Communications Museum Trust - Home National Telephone Kiosk Collection @ Avoncroft Home What's to see... Coming soon eMuseum Timeline of key communications milestones & inventions Alexander Graham Bell & The Telephone 999 service, Police Boxes

value.name: Museum Midtjylland
value.snippet: Museum Midtjylland består af fem kulturhistoriske museer, som hver især fortæller en bid af den midtjyske historie. Både den som er flere tusinde år gammel. Og den som stadig lever i minder, mennesker og håndværk. Så kig forbi, gå på opdagelse i historien – og oplev et Midtjylland både før, nu og i morgen.

value.name: The Telecommunications History Group, Inc - Connections Museum
value.snippet: The museum is open to the public every Sunday from 10 am to 3 pm. However we will be closed on Sunday December 25th 2022 and also closed on Sunday January 1st 2023. The Connections Museum Seattle, formerly the Herbert H. Warrick Jr. Museum of Communications is a part of The Telecommunications History Group, Inc. and is located in the Georgetown neighborhood of Seattle, Washington.

value.name: Communications Museum
value.snippet: Communications Museum - Electronic Device Construction Competition, 2023 Design and produce a device that can be remotely controlled to throw objects to particular area. By participating in this competition, students can make use of their knowledge of science through practical application. Deadline: 22:00:00 on 14/11/2022 (Monday) Regulations

value.name: Velkommen til Vesthimmerlands Museum
value.snippet: Vesthimmerlands Museum er en selvejende institution med afdelinger i Ertebølle og i den centrale udstillingsdel på Johannes V. Jensen & Thit Jensen Museet i Farsø. Vesthimmerlands Museums helt unikke udstillingsbygning er opført efter tegninger af billedkunstner Per Kirkeby og arkitekt Jens Bertelsen og rummer tillige kunsthalsfunktionen Himmerlands Kunstmuseum.

value.name: At the Connections Museum: the insane telephone technology that led to today's computers
value.description: We tour Seattle's Connections Museum, and marvel at rarely seen, fully functioning telephone exchange equipment, from the electro-mechanical 1900's to the all-computerized system of the 1970s. Next time you use a modern computer, give a thought to Bell Labs who invented the transistor and the Unix operating system, all driven by the need for ...

value.name: The Telephone - How It Works
value.description: Have you ever wondered how your voice can travel thousands of kilometres, instantaneously? The transmission of speech long predates Alexander Graham Bell’s telephone of 1876, as makeshift instruments such as pipes or cones were used to project a voice over greater distance. But the telephone as we know it was a more ambitious device; it ...

value.name: A tour of the Vintage Radio and Communications Museum in Windsor CT
value.description: In this video we went down to Windsor Connecticut to visit the vintage radio museum and explore. The web site for this museum is www.vrcmct.org

value.name: Visit to the Museum of Broadcast Communications in Chicago
value.description: Tour of the Broadcast Museum in Chicago. I got see displays from Chicago's own The Bozo Show and Svengolie as well national shows such as Meet the Press. If you would like to support the channel please consider a donation here: https://www.paypal.me/MikesAdventures Also t-shirts available here to support the channel and independent artists ...

value.name: Vintage Radio and Communications Museum Tour
value.description: After my visit to W1AW and ARRL Headquarters, I stopped by the museum. This place has everything. Ham radio, old radios, tubes, televisions, telco, film, computers and on and on. If you go to visit the ARRL, you must leave some time to visit the museum. http://www.vrcmct.org/

value.description: ***SEE BELOW FOR LINKED TABLE OF CONTENTS*** This footage is from a local news team who were doing a story on the opening of the museum. So get your time travel pants, and a mug of ...

value.name: Museum of Broadcasting & Communications (Texas Country Reporter)
value.description: Explore an eclectic mix of vintage broadcast memorabilia & equipment at this one of a kind museum. Chuck Conrad 416 E Main St Kilgore, TX 75662 Phone: 903-985-8115 Website: https://texasbroadcastmuseum.com Tik Tok https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMR7EpeVw/ Facebook https://www.facebook.com/TexasCountryReporter Twitter https://twitter.com/TCRbob Instagram ...

value.name: History of TV and Radio - Museum of Broadcast Communications | Museum Access (S. 1, Episode 7)
value.description: Leslie learns about the broadcast world from its exciting infancy to present day. See the Radio Hall of Fame, the working vintage radio station and a special exhibition: “Here’s Johnny, The Making of The Tonight Show’’. Then we take a Behind-the-Scenes look into the vast archive area that carefully houses broadcast history. Museums are ...

value.name: Out & About: Vintage Radio Museum, CT
value.description: Al and Susan Grimaldi visit the Vintage Radio and Communications Museum of Connecticut, in Windsor.

value.name: operating analog telecom switches, Feb 2017, Seattle's Museum of Communications
value.description: Seattle's amazing and little-known museum of analog telecom technology, where fascinating volunteers, young and old, with a culture all their own, preserve and operate huge analog/mechanical telephone switches of various eras dating back to the early 1920's. A geek's delight! No video can do it justice. Beware: having seen this, you'll have to ...
